item.title: Hyprlua
item.description:
Hyprlua

Hyprlua aims to end my frustration with configuring Hyprland using its configuration file. You can find the project at https://github.com/cacarico/hyprlua

Features

This project currently supports only the features I use from Hyprland, suggestions and contributions are highly enouraged.

Currently Supported
  • Support for binds
  • Support for general config
Soon to be supported
  • Support for submaps in binds
  • Monitor configuration
  • Setup startup executions
  • Exec-once
  • Inputs
  • Monitors

Using

Create a hyprland.lua file

item.title: Techno Haze Tmux
item.description:
Techno Haze Tmux

Tmux has been one of the main tools I use daily and unfortunately configuring it to be on a minimum usable state takes some effort. After having a huge config file for years and suffering to manage it I decided to move it to it’s own plugin.

You can have it up and running by adding a single line in your tmux.conf.

set -g @plugin 'cacarico/techno-haze-tmux'
